verses.text: I will praise you, O LORD, with all my heart; I will tell of all your wonders.
I will be glad and rejoice in you; I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 9 This lament begins like a thanksgiving, but in v. 13 the psalmist turns to the Lord with new petitions, and the psalm concludes on this note. Probably Ps. 9 and 10 were originally a single psalm. Together they form a single acrostic (see Introduction to Hebrew Poetry).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:1
rsbNotes.text: 9:1 wonderful deeds. The Hebrew word refers to the great acts of God, His intervention in human affairs, as at the Exodus from Egypt.

verses.text: My enemies turn back; they stumble and perish before you.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:3
rsbNotes.text: 9:3 When my enemies turn back. This is a statement of future hope, not past reality.

verses.text: For you have upheld my right and my cause; you have sat on your throne, judging righteously.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:4
rsbNotes.text: 9:4 throne, giving righteous judgment. The psalmist is not confident in himself, but in God’s character as the righteous Judge.

verses.text: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the wicked; you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
Endless ruin has overtaken the enemy, you have uprooted their cities; even the memory of them has perished.
The LORD reigns forever; he has established his throne for judgment.
He will judge the world in righteousness; he will govern the peoples with justice.
The LORD is a refuge for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of trouble.
Those who know your name will trust in you, for you, LORD, have never forsaken those who seek you.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:5
rsbNotes.text: 9:5 blotted out their name. To be remembered no more, contrasted with God’s name (v. 2), which will be praised forever.

verses.text: Sing praises to the LORD, enthroned in Zion; proclaim among the nations what he has done.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:11
rsbNotes.text: 9:11 enthroned in Zion. See 2:6 note. The afflicted should know that God is present with them in the world.

verses.text: For he who avenges blood remembers; he does not ignore the cry of the afflicted.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 9:12
rsbNotes.text: 9:12 avenges blood. Lit. “seeks blood.” God does not let wickedness go unpunished (Gen. 9:6; Nah. 1:2–6).
